node.title: Fans in Brazil take frustrations out on VAR after disallowed goal
node.description: Fans of relegation-threatened Grêmio stormed the field and vented their frustrations on VAR after having a late goal ruled out for offside.
node.content:
["Football fans might despise VAR, but supporters of Brazilian club Gr\u00eamio took that hatred too far on Sunday, invading the pitch and destroying equipment after having a goal ruled out for offside in their 3-1 defeat against Palmeiras.", "Gr\u00eamio, from the southern city of Porto Alegre,\u00a0are likely to face\u00a0sanctions, including a possible ban on future home matches, as a result of the disorder.", "The home fans were angry after VAR cancelled out what would have been a late\u00a0equaliser in Sunday's top-flight S\u00e9rie A\u00a0match.", "The goal was cancelled after a VAR check, and second-placed Palmeiras went on to score a third in stoppage time to clinch all three points and leave Gr\u00eamio second bottom of S\u00e9rie A.", "Some Gr\u00eamio fans invaded the pitch while others fought on the terraces.", "The players, who were leaving the field, sought refuge in the dressing rooms.", "", "
Frustrated Gr\u00eamio supporters stormed the field after seeing their team lose at home.(Getty Images: Silvio Avila)
", "Ronaldo Botelho Piacente, procurator-general of Brazil's Supreme Court of Sporting Justice, said an inquiry could lead to Gr\u00eamio being fined up to 100,000 reais ($23,420) and forced to play as many as 10 games behind closed doors or at an alternative venue away from Porto Alegre.", "\"This will be investigated,\" Piacente told Brazilian media company\u00a0O Globo.", "\"The intention is that Gr\u00eamio will lose their home rights.\"", "", "
Police eventually forced the Gr\u00eamio supporters back into the stands.(Getty Images: Silvio Avila)
", "Gr\u00eamio said in a statement\u00a0on Monday it did \"not agree with the acts committed by a small portion of the fans in attendance to yesterday's match.\"", "It added it was cooperating with police and considering banning the guilty supporters from its home matches.\u00a0", "The crowd trouble at the 60,000-capacity Arena do Gr\u00eamio occurred even though stadiums in Brazil are still only allowing a limited number of fans due to concerns about the spread of COVID-19.", "ABC/Wires"]
